home.title:
Hi, I'm Veronika üëãüèª
Frontend developer
& UX Enthusiast
home.desc:
Yes, I'm that person who opens Figma and isn't scared.

I transform layouts into clean, adaptive markup ‚Äî so everything looks right in Chrome, Safari, and even IE (just kidding, no one looks at IE anymore... I hope).

My main focus is React (TypeScript), but I also comfortably work with Vue and Angular.

development.title: Development
development.description: Information about development will be here.

mentoring.title: Mentoring
mentoring.description: Information about mentoring will be here.

skills.title: What's in my toolkit?
skills.desc: Aside from a steady mind and a stockpile of coffee

items.title: HTML: Structure With Purpose
items.description: Markup is architecture, not just tags. I shape the page from meaningful blocks to proper heading flow. Semantics are for real people, not just to pleasing validators.

items.title: Accessibility (a11y)
items.description: WCAG standards? Check. ARIA roles used as intended. Screen readers (NVDA, VoiceOver), keyboard navigation, focus states ‚Äî all tested. Respect `prefers-*`, `pointer`, color settings and etc.

items.title: Responsive & Cross-Browser
items.description: Designed for humans ‚Äî not just perfect mockups. Retina screens, breakpoints, awkward DPIs, Safari quirks ‚Äî all taken into account before QA raises a brow.

items.title: BEM Naming
items.description: Readable, purposeful class names are non-negotiable. Modifiers aren't mixes, roles aren't blurred, and every class does exactly one thing ‚Äî and says so.

items.title: Smart CSS: Variables, Layers, Containers
items.description: !important stays untouched ‚Äî I manage the cascade cleanly. Custom properties keep styles flexible. Media queries cover more than breakpoints: hover, orientation, user quirks ‚Äî I'm on it.

items.title: Preprocessors
items.description: Sass is second nature ‚Äî from functions to placeholders and deep nesting logic. Styles stay clean and maintainable. Less or Stylus? Not a problem.

items.title: CSS Modules
items.description: Scoped styles = zero drama. No global leaks, no naming accidents. Easy to reuse, easy to scale, easy for teammates to trust.

items.title: CSS-in-JS
items.description: When styles live in the component, context and logic go side by side. Styled Components or Emotion ‚Äî used both in production more than once.

items.title: Storybook
items.description: Components come with documentation. Storybook shows everything ‚Äî edge cases included. Great for designers, QAs, and future me. No need to ask, 'What does this look like?'

items.title: Interactivity
items.description: No gimmicks, just smooth experience. Hovers, clicks, navigation ‚Äî behave the way users intuitively expect. Predictable, not boring. Familiar, not rigid.

items.title: Animations
items.description: From subtle microinteractions to timeline beasts. CSS handles the light stuff, GSAP brings choreography. Every motion earns its place ‚Äî to guide the user, not just decorate.

items.title: Figma
items.description: Design files don't need decoding. I get auto layout, constraints, components ‚Äî and know where to look when something's off. Catch inconsistencies, clarify logic, and bring the mockup to life.

items.title: UI Kits ‚â† Gospel
items.description: I'm analyzing UI kits, not just accept. Missing states? Weird spacing? Logic gaps? All spotted. Always open to ask, suggest, and adapt ‚Äî not blindly follow.

items.title: UI Libraries (MUI, AntD, CDS etc.)
items.description: I've gone deeper than the docs. Know how themes, slots, styled APIs, internal hooks, and override system stick. Integration is clean, no hacks, no fragile band-aids.

items.title: JavaScript
items.description: From DOM to event handling ‚Äî everything to make the interface feel alive. ES6 features like destructuring and arrow functions? Of course. Logic stays lean and in sync with the markup.

items.title: TypeScript
items.description: Types are a design tool, not just a safety net. From prop definitions to utility types and generics ‚Äî everything's there to keep the codebase confident and honest.

items.title: React
items.description: React isn't just a library ‚Äî it's a mindset. Props and states link data and UI. Effects, callbacks, memoization ‚Äî used where they matter. Not over-engineered, not under-thought.

items.title: Vue
items.description: Reactive core, computed props, and directives ‚Äî all understood and used to keep logic separate from markup. Templates stay clean, scripts stay smart. No spaghetti.

items.title: Angular
items.description: Strict but reliable. I use containers, directives, input/output binding ‚Äî and write component logic that stays clear and testable. Behavior is defined cleanly with methods.

items.title: Linters & Code Style
items.description: ESLint, Prettier, Stylelint ‚Äî configured per team and project. Consistent style = stable project. Automation takes care of the routine, so focus stays on the logic.

items.title: Fast adaptation
items.description: New stack? No problem. The main thing is not to look for "how to make it beautiful," but to understand why it doesn't work.

items.title: Version control systems
items.description: I know how to roll back not only in life, but also by commits. I navigate branches, resolve conflicts. I can cherry-pick if necessary. I have used GitHub, GitLab, Bitbucket and am familiar with Git Flow.

items.title: Development Methodologies
items.description: I have worked with various approaches: Agile (Scrum) ‚Äî for flexible and changing projects, Waterfall ‚Äî for clearly planned and stable ones, and Kanban ‚Äî for optimizing workflow in small teams or for support.

items.title: Soft skills
items.description: I know how to work in a team, share knowledge, and am not afraid to ask questions. I interact closely with designers, testers, and managers to create a quality product.
